comments:
It is possible to change the jar files used by Ant in the preferences window.
However, changes to these jar files are lost the next time I start up Eclipse.

Scenario:
- in Ant preferences remove default ant.jar and optional.jar with Remove
- in Ant preferences add other ant.jar and optional.jar with Add
- quit Eclipse
- start Eclipse
- go to Ant preferences: the original jar files are back; the changes are lost

Second (possibly related) problem:
As a workaround I use the ANT_HOME setting, which works ok.
But sometimes when re-starting Eclipse, it seems to use the 1.5.1 ant jar 
files, whereas the preferences specify my own Ant home (ant 1.4.1). 
Setting the ANT_HOME setting in preferences off and then on, 
solves the problem ...
*** Bug 26832 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I cannot reproduce.

What build(s) was this occurring on?

Can either of you attempt to reproduce this problem on the integration build 
that is produced tomorrow?
I tried it on M3 build.  I haven't checked the latest integration build.

Well, I tried the latest milestone build, and both problems seem to have
been solved.

However, the milestone build introduces a new problem, i.e. it does 
work with Ant 1.4.1 resulting in following error:

Thank you for checking.
Your new problem has been identified (and a temp fix is in today's integration 
build). See bug 26523 and bug 27128. Note this problem does not exist if using 
Ant 1.5.1.
